title: The Enneagram Parent's Guide to Children's Mental Health

primaryAudience.name: Enneagram-Aware Parents
primaryAudience.description: Parents who are familiar with the Enneagram and want to apply it to understand and support their children's mental health

demographics.psychographics: Self-reflective parents who value emotional intelligence and conscious parenting. They seek tools and frameworks to better understand themselves and their children.

secondaryAudiences.name: Mental Health Professionals
secondaryAudiences.description: Therapists, counselors, and child psychologists interested in personality-based approaches
secondaryAudiences.overlap: Professional interest in personality frameworks for child development

secondaryAudiences.name: New Enneagram Enthusiasts
secondaryAudiences.description: Parents just discovering the Enneagram who want practical applications
secondaryAudiences.overlap: Seeking actionable ways to apply Enneagram knowledge in daily life

personas.name: Sarah - Type 1 Perfectionist Parent
personas.description: A detail-oriented mother who worries about doing everything 'right' and struggles with her child's emotional outbursts
painPoints: Feeling like she's failing when her child struggles
Difficulty accepting that parenting isn't perfect
Worry about whether she's causing her child's problems
goals: Learn to recognize normal vs concerning behaviors
Develop patience with the parenting process
Support her child without being overly critical

personas.name: Marcus - Type 6 Anxious Parent
personas.description: A father who tends to worry about worst-case scenarios and wants to protect his children from all potential harm
painPoints: Constant worry about child's safety and wellbeing
Difficulty knowing when concern is appropriate vs excessive
Fear of missing warning signs of mental health issues
goals: Learn to distinguish between normal and concerning behaviors
Develop confidence in his parenting decisions
Create a safe environment without being overprotective

personas.name: Lisa - Type 2 Helper Parent
personas.description: A mother who focuses intensely on her children's needs and emotions, sometimes at the expense of boundaries
painPoints: Difficulty setting healthy boundaries with children
Taking on her children's emotional problems as her own
Feeling guilty when she can't 'fix' her child's struggles
goals: Learn healthy ways to support without enabling
Understand when to step back and let children process
Maintain her own mental health while caring for others

painPoints: Struggling to know when child's behavior is normal vs concerning
Feeling overwhelmed by parenting decisions related to mental health
Difficulty understanding their child's emotional needs
Worry about damaging their child's mental health
Not knowing when to seek professional help
Feeling unprepared to handle child's anxiety or depression
Confusion about how their own personality affects their parenting
Guilt about family mental health history
Fear of stigmatizing their child by seeking help
topicsAddressed: Recognizing early mental health warning signs by type
Type-specific parenting approaches for mental health
Building resilience in children based on their temperament
When and how to seek professional help
Creating type-appropriate environments for mental wellness
Family dynamics and mental health patterns

keywords: children mental health by personality type
early warning signs child depression anxiety
targetQueries: how to support child mental health enneagram
when to worry about child behavior

contentGoals: Educate parents about type-aware mental health support
Provide practical tools for recognizing concerning patterns
Reduce stigma around children's mental health
Empower parents to seek help when needed
Build community around conscious, informed parenting

socialMediaFocus.twitter: Educational threads about parenting insights and mental health awareness
socialMediaFocus.instagram: Visual guides and relatable parenting moments with mental health tips
socialMediaFocus.reddit: Community support and experience sharing in parenting and mental health subreddits
